citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process starting at 10:31 AM
on 21-NOV-2023. The inspector first attempted to make contact at the facility starting at 10:31 AM via phone call and text
message to the licensee however there was no reply. A phone call to a secondary facility contact was attempted at 10:54
AM however there was no reply. A voicemail was left by the inspector for both the licensee and the secondary facility
contact. The inspector waited at a nearby gas station as well as at the outer gate of the facility. While waiting at the outer
gate of the facility, a person who is not the licensee was observed just inside the inner gate at the end of the drive and
appeared to be removing tools from the back of a truck. The person did not come to the gate or acknowledge the
presence of the inspector’s vehicle. Pet dogs were running outside and aware of the inspector’s presence - they ran up to
the inner gate and barked. The dogs were in close proximity to the person at the truck. After waiting one hour, a text
message was sent to the secondary contact at 11:32 AM notifying them that the inspector was leaving the area.
End Section

narrative:
2.126(b)  Repeat
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process starting at 10:31 AM 
on 21-NOV-2023. The inspector first attempted to make contact at the facility starting at 10:31 AM via phone call and text 
message to the licensee however there was no reply. A phone call to a secondary facility contact was attempted at 10:54 
AM however there was no reply. A voicemail was left by the inspector for both the licensee and the secondary facility 
contact. The inspector waited at a nearby gas station as well as at the outer gate of the facility. While waiting at the outer 
gate of the facility, a person who is not the licensee was observed just inside the inner gate at the end of the drive and 
appeared to be removing tools from the back of a truck. The person did not come to the gate or acknowledge the 
presence of the inspector’s vehicle. Pet dogs were running outside and aware of the inspector’s presence - they ran up to 
the inner gate and barked. The dogs were in close proximity to the person at the truck. After waiting one hour, a text 
message was sent to the secondary contact at 11:32 AM notifying them that the inspector was leaving the area. 
 
 
End Section
